cerberus_speed-trap.company_description:
"Celebrus Technologies was founded in 1999. The original objective was to measure the experience and performance of web sites and online applications by embedding smart applications in the web pages themselves which would run in the visitor's browser to capture a true and accurate picture of the performance of the site, from the end-user's perspective.

This revolutionary idea resulted in technology that was awarded several patents for its innovation.We then recognized that this approach to the capture of data from within the page and browser had applications far beyond the measurement of site speed and performance."

adbull.company_description: "AdBull provides publishers with a new stream of advertiser-driven revenue—it's completely additive and doesn't displace other forms of advertising you may currently use. Our patented ad delivery solution changes the state of the cursor for a few seconds, while the ad is 'clickable.' The cursor then returns to its normal state after the ad fades out. If the user doesn't interact with the AdBull ad within a few seconds, the cursor returns to normal. If they do click, a new window opens with the advertiser's landing page or website."

coinurl.company_description:
"We offer interstitial and banner advertising. Interstitial ads let you monetize links, even if you don't own the target website. They can also be placed on a web page with an overlay script, allowing you to earn on any visitor simply by having them visit the page. Interstitial ads are billed using a pay per impression system and are better suited for increasing the advertiser's brand awareness.
Banner ads fitted for websites bring in users who are genuinely interested in the advertiser's product. They are billed with the popular pay per click system."

gdn_notice.company_description:
"Many websites, such as news sites and blogs, join the Google Display
Network, which enables Google to show ads on their sites. Based on your
visits to these websites, Google uses an advertising cookie (from
DoubleClick) to associate your browser with interest and demographic
categories. Google then uses these categories to show interest-based ads
on these websites. Google's Ads Preferences Manager lets you edit these
categories associated with your browser.

Using the Ads Preferences Manager, you can edit the list of inferred
interest and demographic categories that Google has associated with your
cookie or opt-out of the cookie entirely.

All information Google gathers is used in accordance with Google's privacy
policy and helps Google improve your online experience. It is not used to
identify you personally and Google will not show interest-based ads based on
personal information without your permission. We also will not show
interest-based ads based on sensitive information or interest categories,
such as those based on, race, religion, sexual orientation, health, or
sensitive financial categories, without your opt-in consent."

google_affiliate_network.company_description:
"Many websites, such as news sites and blogs, join the Google Display
Network, which enables Google to show ads on their sites. Based on your
visits to these websites, Google uses an advertising cookie (from
DoubleClick) to associate your browser with interest and demographic
categories. Google then uses these categories to show interest-based ads
on these websites. Google's Ads Preferences Manager lets you edit these
categories associated with your browser.

Using the Ads Preferences Manager, you can edit the list of inferred
interest and demographic categories that Google has associated with your
cookie or opt-out of the cookie entirely.

All information Google gathers is used in accordance with Google's privacy
policy and helps Google improve your online experience. It is not used to
identify you personally and Google will not show interest-based ads based on
personal information without your permission. We also will not show
interest-based ads based on sensitive information or interest categories,
such as those based on, race, religion, sexual orientation, health, or
sensitive financial categories, without your opt-in consent."

google_adsense.company_description:
"Many websites, such as news sites and blogs, join the Google Display
Network, which enables Google to show ads on their sites. Based on your
visits to these websites, Google uses an advertising cookie (from
DoubleClick) to associate your browser with interest and demographic
categories. Google then uses these categories to show interest-based ads
on these websites. Google's Ads Preferences Manager lets you edit these
categories associated with your browser.

Using the Ads Preferences Manager, you can edit the list of inferred
interest and demographic categories that Google has associated with your
cookie or opt-out of the cookie entirely.

All information Google gathers is used in accordance with Google's privacy
policy and helps Google improve your online experience. It is not used to
identify you personally and Google will not show interest-based ads based on
personal information without your permission. We also will not show
interest-based ads based on sensitive information or interest categories,
such as those based on, race, religion, sexual orientation, health, or
sensitive financial categories, without your opt-in consent."
